WorkItem.Description:
For comparison, Spellpower is valued at 1.00 DPS in all these examples.
 
Looking at the Relative Stat values shows Spirit reacting very weirdly with Fel Armor.
 
Numbers are without Glyph of Lifetap. Adding GoLT adds .2 DPS to Spirit's value unless otherwise noted.
674 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 1.00 DPS.
679 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 0 DPS.
696 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 0 DPS.
701 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 1.00 DPS.
(701 Spirit + Fel Armor + Glyph of Lifetap: 1 Spirit = .57 DPS)
817 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 0 DPS.
828 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 0.35 DPS.
(828 Spirit + Fel Armor + Glyph of Lifetap: 1 Spirit = 1.20 DPS)
833 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 0 DPS
839 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 0 DPS
848 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 1.00 DPS
855 Spirit + Fel Armor: 1 Spirit = 0 DPS
 
 
(Different Spirit totals were achieved by switching between Master's & Sanctified spellthreads on pants, and between Major Spirit/Powerful Stats/No enchant on chest.)

Comments.Message: If 1 Spellpower = 1.00 DPS, Fel Armor *should* make Spirit worth .3 across the board... yes?
Without Demonic Aegis, yes - 0.3.  Add an additional 0.03 for each point of DA, up to a max of 0.39 for 3 points of DA.
